docs.summary: Provides functionality for elements that accept text as input.

srcDocs.summary: Provides functionality for elements that accept text as input.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the maximum number of characters that can be entered.
description: Setting the `maxLength` property of an input element to a
positive number restricts user input, by manual entry or pasting, to
text that does not exceed the `maxLength`. However, it does not limit
your ability to change the element's value to one that exceeds
`maxLength` programmatically.
To remove the maximum length restriction that has been set on the input
element, set `maxLength` to `0`.
Getting the `maxLength` property returns the element's
current `maxLength` setting.
The number of characters is calculated by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_point"
target="_blank">Unicode code points.

examples.title: Remove an element's maximum length restriction

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the maximum number of characters that can be entered.
description: Setting the `maxLength` property of an input element to a
positive number restricts user input, by manual entry or pasting, to

To remove the maximum length restriction that has been set on the input

Getting the `maxLength` property returns the element's

examples.title: Remove an element's maximum length restriction

docs.summary: Sets or gets the element's placeholder text.
description: Placeholder text is typically used to provide a
hint to the user of what to enter into a input element that accepts
text. When the user begins to enter text, the placeholder text disappears.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the element's placeholder text.
description: Placeholder text is typically used to provide a
hint to the user of what to enter into a input element that accepts
text. When the user begins to enter text, the placeholder text disappears.

params.name: eventHandler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when a key is pressed.
params.srcDoc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when a key is pressed.

ret.doc: The element on which the event is now registered.
ret.srcDoc: The element on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when the cursor is inside the
 input element and a key is pressed.
description: A text input receives a `keyPress` event when a user presses a key on
the keyboard while the cursor is inside the input element.

examples.title: Get the key that was pressed
Get all of the keyboard event's properties

srcDocs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when the cursor is inside the
 input element and a key is pressed.
description: A text input receives a `keyPress` event when a user presses a key on
the keyboard while the cursor is inside the input element.

examples.title: Get the key that was pressed
Get all of the keyboard event's properties

notes:
Some browsers do not issue a key press event for certain keys,
 such as arrow keys or the shift key.

**Deprecation note:** The $w parameter of event handlers is being deprecated. To get a scoped selector, use the $w.at() function and pass it the context property of the event parameter: $item = $w.at(event.context). To learn more, see here.
